text: when I was diagnosed with diabetes I was
dumbfounded I was 200 pounds at 57 but I
wasn't physically working out or doing
anything in particular and I attended
piedmont diabetes clinic and learned how
to properly eat and take care of myself
I came home I went through all of my
cabinets a my refrigerator and threw
everything out and I decided I'm going
to get rid of this I'm going to turn
this around in six months and that was
my goal I was concerned about what
diabetes would do to my body once i
received a diagnosis and i did not want
to have to deal with any of that so I
did additional research and found out
you know people have had amputations
they've gone blind they've had other
health issues pancreas issues they've
had liver issues kidney issues and I was
determined not to have to go through
that one of the things that is most
beneficial for people with diabetes is
to take into consideration our ancestors
what they did and they were basically
hunters and gatherers and so I said okay
let's berries fruits vegetables that was
just common sense logical to me so I
went to the farmers market and went
shopping so I was kind of surprised my
grocery bills went down from about one
hundred and twenty dollars a week down
to forty dollars a week and I was so
impressed with that that was a
motivating factor to change my diet I
had set a goal for myself to reverse my
diagnosis within a six-month period and
I was so determined I'm I managed to
accomplish that within three months and
to alleviate my life of the additional
stress of having
iBD's with paramount to me in order to
get my life back on track
you
